title: Stop making Ashe free
body:
It takes 2-3 games to buy Ashe with IP, and yet I see her more than any other AD carry in the rotation.

Please stop.



EDIT: Didn't expect this to get past 7 up votes. I guess I'll spend some more effort on this post.

I know that the free week champions are for new players, but I remember as a level 15 "nocturne main" that was completely sick of every game getting stomped by Master Yi wishing I could try poppy, and so I did with 450 IP. I barely felt the loss in IP. Meanwhile, I was waiting every single free week for exactly three champions: Jayce, Kha'zix, and Aatrox. These guys seemed really cool to me but would take literally 14 times the IP it would take to buy, for instance, Ashe. It was frustrating then that all these extremely cheap champions were free while those free week slots could have been replaced by champions that seemed so inaccessible to me, and it's frustrating now.

replies.body: The free rotation is for new players. She's easy to play.

Ashe is way harder to do well with than other more forgiving AD carries ESPECIALLY for new players who probably play with other new players that cannot properly exploit the advantages Ashe brings to the table

but her concepts are easier to grasp and at their core are very simple. She's very easy to understand in a game where new players are bombarded by a LOT of new information they have to take in and adjust to. Ashe is a good champion to play when you are just starting even if you may not necessarily know how to use her to capacity. Quite honestly a genuinely new player will not use any champion to full capacity or even close to that.
There are a few other easy marksman too that are pretty simple but ashe generally I find easier to understand at a glance than any other marksman save maybe Caitlyn is equal

I didn't understand why she was so hard to last hit with, why I had so little damage, or how her E worked. I wasn't really able to use her passive properly, and I was always oom. 

When I tried her again in a few months, she was fine. If you ask me, you need to have a basic understanding of how to play the game to play her properly.

Ashe is a great ADC to teach new players. She has mana management, has an ability that helps show how important vision is, self-peel, and an ult to initiate fights. She's fairly low mechanical intensity compared to say, Vayne or Kog. She's just a really good ADC for people to learn on. I think she needs to stay in the rotation, but maybe dial her back some and replace her more often with other safe/simple ADCs like Cait/Trist.
